pageTitle: Gold Seeker Closing Report: Gold and Silver Fall Over 1% and 2%
textBeforeTable: The Economy:   Gold miners need $3,000 price in five years - gold council Reuters   Gold and silver equities fell a little over 1% by midmorning before they rebounded midday, but they then fell back off again in afternoon trade and ended with almost 4% losses.   Euro gold fell to about 1212, platinum lost $4 to $1431, and copper dropped 4 cents to about $3.49.   Gold fell to $1548.10 in Asia before it
textAfterTable: Tomorrow at 8:30AM EST brings Housing Starts for April expected at 680,000 and Building Permits expected at 730,000.  At 9:15 is Industrial Production for April expected at 0.5% and Capacity Utilization expected at 79.0%, and at 2PM are FOMC Minutes from the feds April 25th meeting.   The Markets:   Charts Courtesy of http://finance.yahoo.com/   Oil fell as the U.S. dollar index and treasuries rose on persistent worries about Greece that dragged the Dow, Nasdaq,
